thread.title: White House Backs ‘Right to Try’ Law for Terminally Ill Patients - WSJ
thread.title_full: White House Backs ‘Right to Try’ Law for Terminally Ill Patients - WSJ

author: Thomas M. Burton
title: White House Backs ‘Right to Try’ Law for Terminally Ill Patients - WSJ
text:
White House Backs ‘Right to Try’ Law for Terminally Ill Patients Rules related to access to experimental treatments would be relaxed By @TomBurtonWSJ Feb. 7, 2017 6:01 p.m. ET 
The White House is giving a big boost to proponents of a federal Right to Try law that they contend would give terminally ill patients easier access to medicines that haven’t won approval from the Food and Drug Administration. 
Some supporters of the bill met Tuesday with Vice President Mike Pence, and last week they won a supportive statement from President Donald Trump, who has been contending that too many FDA rules in general pose unnecessary hurdles to drug approval.
